author: @GbaseGear
title: LSL Bad Bone Deluxe Natural Gloss > Guitars Electric Solid Body | Distinctive Guitar
text: This Bad Bone DX from LsL Instruments not only sounds amazing but has a stunning quilt Maple top. This T is setup with 2 humbuckers that have a great vintage sound, but are ready for any amount of gain you throw at them. They can be split as well, to get sweet single coil sounds. The satin neck feel great and the the fingerboard has perfectly rolled edges for easy comfortable shredding! Mint Shop Demo Piece-Authorized Dealer, Full Warranty Still Included. Specs: Model: Bad Bone 2 Deluxe Body Wood: Roasted Alder Top Wood: Roasted Quilt Maple Binding: Black Finish Color: Natural Gloss Pickguard: Black Neck Wood: Roasted Flame 5A Fingerboard Wood: Roasted Flame 5A Neck Finish: Satin Scale Length: 25.5" Neck Shape: Medium C Fingerboard Radius: 9.5" Nut Width: 1 5/8th Frets: 22 Inlays: Dots Hardware Color: Chrome Tuners: Vintage Bridge: Vintage Neck Pickup: Humbucker Bridge Pickup: Humbucker Knobs: Volume, Tone Switching: 3-way Extra Controls: Push/Pull Splits Strings: 10-46 Case: Hardshell Condition: New Major Credit Cards Accepted Through PayPal, Bank Wire, Cashiers Check and Money Order also accepted. DOMESTIC (CONUS) - All orders within the contiguous USA SHIP FREE and fast direct to you via FedEx Ground. Guitars are always shipped with signature required. Orders to Hawaii or Alaska will incur an additional shipping charge. Overnight, 2-Day, and Express shipping is available for an additional fee. INTERNATIONAL - International shipping is available on all orders. Shipping charges are calculated at checkout. Customs duties are the responsibility of the buyer. RETURN POLICY - At Distinctive Guitar customer satisfaction is our top priority. We are happy to offer you a 48hr approval period on all orders (excludes custom orders and layaways). Return arrangements must be made within 48 hours of receipt and must be authorized by Distinctive Guitar prior to shipment. Refunds on approved returns will be made in-full less shipping costs both ways and applicable credit card fees. Feel free to use your refund in-full on another "In Stock Item". In limited circumstances, returns outside the 48 hour approval window may be considered but are subject to a 15% re-stocking fee. Trades are considered final sale due to the large amount of shipping fees and risk associated with a trade transaction. We are happy to discuss approval prior to trading if required. Sale, clearance, demo, and NOS items are considered final sale and no refunds or returns are allowed on these items. All orders must be returned in the condition they were originally shipped within 5 business days after return approval. If any of the above criteria is not met Distinctive Guitar reserves the right to refuse the return or a higher re-stocking fee may apply. All returns are handled on a case by case basis so if you have any issues or concerns don't hesitate to contact us.

author: @WeArePindula
title: Zimbabwe Braces For Another Drought
text:
[Home](/)
[Weather and Climate](/category/weather-and-climate/)
Zimbabwe Braces For Another Drought
Zimbabwe is facing the prospect of another drought, which could exacerbate hunger for millions already affected by an El Niño-induced drought, the UN World Food Programme said on Thursday.
Earlier this year, Zimbabwe and several neighbouring countries declared a state of disaster due to severe food shortages caused by the worst drought in 40 years.
While rainfall was expected to begin in October, marking the start of the typical six-month rainy season, Zimbabwe has only experienced a few days of rain in late November.
During a food distribution event in Chivi, southern Zimbabwe, World Food Programme country director Barbara Clemens said (via [ZimLive](https://www.zimlive.com/zimbabwe-at-risk-of-another-dry-season-after-el-nino-drought-says-wfp/)):
We are worried. You can see the ground in front of us is bone dry.
Families in the district are already skipping meals to stretch their limited food supplies.
Georgina Maphosa, 74, expressed her concern about worsening hunger next year, as the maize crop she planted in late November has failed to germinate.
In May, the government said that more than half of Zimbabwe’s population of 16 million was in need of food aid this year.
More: [Pindula News](https://www.pindula.co.zw/)

author: Marifer Ibáñez
title: Del Piero, feliz de compartir futbol con amigos y excompañeros en Monterrey | ABC Noticias
text: Monterrey. –Alessandro Del Piero ya está en la Ciudad de Monterrey y dijo estar listo para encarar el partido de leyendas junto con sus compañeros y amigos de la Juventus y de Selección Italiana, Gianluigi Buffon y Andrea Pirlo. Del Piero llegó procedente de Madrid, con una sonrisa firmando autógrafos a los aficionados que se dieron cita en el Aeropuerto de Monterrey. “Muy contento de estar aquí, otra vez en México y vamos a ver mañana a ver qué pasa, es un momento para todo para jugar al futbol juntos, con alegría y con muchas ganas”. El ex campeón del Mundo estará jugando también con Carles Puyol y Xavi Hernández, a quienes tubo de rivales infinidad de veces en Champions League, así como Eurocopas o Copas del Mundo, y ahora vestirán la misma playera, a pesar de que es un juego amistoso, el ex jugador italiano no deja de un lado la competencia. “Sí, compartir con los compañeros que jugamos muchas veces o encontrar nuevos y competir un poquito, siempre es con alegría.” El equipo de leyendas internacionales lo completan el argentino: Maxi Rodríguez, Julio César, David Trezeguet, Diego Forlán, Youri Djorkaeff, John Terry, Didier Drogba, Javier Zanetti, Alexi Lalas y Houssine Kharja. Alessandro del Piero estará jugando el juego de Leyendas el viernes en el Gigante de acero a las 21:00 horas, donde se enfrentarán Leyendas internacionales de FIFA contra leyendas del Futbol mexicano.

author: Kiana Wilson
title: Recent snowfall elevates avalanche danger in the Flathead
text:
HUNGRY HORSE — Avalanche danger is growing in the Flathead as snow hits the region and forecasters have hit the slopes to keep people updated on backcountry conditions.
“We had a dry spell before Christmas, but then right after Christmas, we've experienced a lot of heavy snowfall, which has increased the avalanche danger,” said Flathead Avalanche Lead Forecaster Mark Dundas.
The Flathead Avalanche Center reports six skier-triggered avalanches in the backcountry near Whitefish Mountain Resort at the end of December alone.
“One of those did result in an individual taking a ride in the slide. Fortunately, they were not hurt. They stayed on top. They did not hit a tree on the way down. They did, however, lose their skis, and they had to utilize one of their partner's skis to get out and back to the resort, but fortunately, they're okay,” said Dundas.
Now that that storm has passed and the snow has settled, avalanche danger has slightly decreased. But the season is just beginning and people who recreate in the backcountry still need to be aware of the dangers.
“All the snow fell without wind, which is highly unusual. So there's a bunch of low-density snow sitting on the snow surface waiting to be moved by wind. Avalanches are highly specific on weather events, and it's really hard to determine what the rest of the winter is going to be like,” said Dundas.
Forecasters will be out monitoring conditions as winter continues to move through the region and issue an avalanche report every morning at 7 a.m.
Officials urge anyone who intends to venture into the backcountry to carry the proper safety gear.
“We recommend people get educated, take a class. If you're going in the backcountry, you always should carry a shovel, probe and an avalanche beacon and know how to use them,” said Dundas.
There is one more avalanche class scheduled for Jan. 6 from 6 p.m. to 7 p.m. at Great Northern Cycle and Ski.
[Click here](https://www.flatheadavalanche.org/) for more information on the class and to view the daily avalanche reports.
